keyTakeAways: Tropical Storm Fengshen caused heavy flooding and landslides across the Philippines, particularly in Luzon and Mindanao.
At least five people were killed, including two children, when a tree fell on a bamboo house in Quezon province.
A teenage boy survived the incident in Pitogo, near Manila, and rescue teams were actively working to recover the bodies.
Over 47,000 people evacuated to temporary shelters due to the storm’s impact on Luzon and surrounding islands.
Five dams on Luzon released water to manage flood risks, indicating severe hydrological pressure.
A landslide in Bukidnon, Mindanao, resulted in two people being reported missing after a vehicle fell off a highway.
Floodwaters overwhelmed areas in Calbayog City, Samar, and other central Philippine islands, forcing evacuations and damaging homes.
The Philippines is vulnerable to frequent storms and typhoons, with climate change intensifying extreme weather events.
The disaster follows a recent series of earthquakes that killed at least 87 people, highlighting the country's ongoing disaster burden.
Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. emphasized the need to strengthen disaster preparedness and response systems.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Tropical Storm Fengshen triggered severe flooding and landslides across the Philippines, resulting in at least five deaths and two missing persons. In Quezon province, a family of five was killed when a tree fell on their bamboo house in Pitogo, while a teenage boy survived. In Mindanao, a landslide caused a vehicle to fall off a highway in Bukidnon, leading to two people missing. Over 47,000 people evacuated to temporary shelters, and five dams on Luzon released water to manage flood risks. The storm's impacts occurred amid a backdrop of previous earthquakes, underscoring the country’s ongoing vulnerability to natural disasters. Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stressed the need to improve disaster preparedness and response as a result of repeated extreme weather events, which scientists link to climate change.
title: Five dead, two missing as Tropical Storm Fengshen soaks Philippines
